Help:Node.title: General Concepts: Manipulation
Help:Node.Log:Description:
Title: Manipulation
Important Commands: accept, drop, give, inventory, place, put, take
There are many moveable objects in $(theatre.gamebrief). {? equal | $(theatre.gameid) | GES |Resolution shards| Clothing, food, and weapons} are just the start. You'll want to manipulate these objects in different ways, doing everything from picking them up to throwing them across the room.
The basic manipulation of objects is easy. If you want something, you $(udat.chatchar)TAKE [OBJECT]. When you're done with something, you $(udat.chatchar)DROP [OBJECT]. You can see what you are carrying by typing $(udat.chatchar)INVENTORY (or $(udat.chatchar)I or ($(udat.chatchar)LOOK AT ME).
Instead of just dropping objects, you can place objects in specific relations to other objects. For example: $(udat.chatchar)PLACE BREAD ROLL ON ROUND TABLE or $(udat.chatchar)THROW GLASS AT HEARTH or $(udat.chatchar)PUT DAGGER UNDER TRESTLE TABLE.
You can also give objects to other people: $(udat.chatchar)GIVE [OBJECT] TO [PERSON]. If someone offers you an item, you must accept it in order to take the item: $(udat.chatchar)ACCEPT [OBJECT].
Certain types of objects can also be manipulated in other ways. For example you $(udat.chatchar)WEAR and $(udat.chatchar)REMOVE clothing and you $(udat.chatchar)WIELD weapons.
See Also: Bulk, Clothing, Combat, Containers
